basic.description: This course provides a critical analysis of certain key issues and developments in contemporary fiduciary law and theory with comparative reference to the position in Canadian, English, Australian and South African law.  Specific topics include the principles governing the incidence of fiduciary duties, the nature, purpose and scope of such duties, the ways in which they differ from other kinds of duties, and the remedies that attach to their breach.  Students undertaking the course will gain an understanding of the uncertainty and the theoretical debates and challenges that continue to surround these principles and the different ways in which the courts in different jurisdictions have sought to resolve them.
basic.subject: LAW
basic.title: Issues and Developments in Contemporary Fiduciary Law and Theory
